website_summaries.verdict: An unbeatable deal for a quality water bottle. Simply the best value if you are looking for convenient features at a low price.
pros: Made by the brand that pioneered modern water bottles
The Polar has features we love like BPA-free construction, a carrying handle, and double-walled insulation, all at an affordable price
cons: Doesn't keep drinks cold as long as more costly water bottles, but most would overlook this issue for the low price

customer_reviews.title: Can't really ask more of a water bottle
customer_reviews.text: This lasted me for years college. Lost it finally and went right back for another one. No leaks, really nothing to complain about. The insulating jacket withstood many drops and falls and I don't believe any condensation developed when I'd stick it in the dishwasher. That's another plus, you can fully disassemble it and stick the whole thing in the dishwasher. The insulation is nice but not infinitely efficient. If you leave cold water in a hot car all day, it'll still get hot. But I really like this bottle most for the durability and ease of use. It's pretty cheap and an excellent value.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew D. Royappa

customer_reviews.title: The beverage does not stay cold
customer_reviews.text: Not only did my water not stay cold but the bottle is opaque so you can't see how much you've filled it. I hold my water bottles under the water dispenser on my refrigerator. I need to be able to see inside the bottle so it doesn't overflow. Can't see inside this one so either I had to fill a measuring cup first and then pour it into the bottle; or, I had to keep stopping the fill and look and see how much room I had left. Very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Mystery Maven

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Molds easily, even with daily washing & drying. Would not recommend. Would not purchase again.
customer_reviews.author: Rea.

customer_reviews.title: These last a long time, and do their job just fine.
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 of these I use almost weekly on bike rides. They sit in the bottle cages, keep my liquid in there, and keep it cold enough for my tastes. They have even been dropped trying to get into the bottle cages and took a ride down the road a few times at speed, no problem. Low and behold I was reviewing my orders, and realize my two bottle are 11 years old! They got a few knicks, and may drip around the edges, but nothing I'm worried about.
customer_reviews.author: John Poster

customer_reviews.title: Works as well as expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these for my wife and I so we wouldn't have lukewarm drinks. I did not expect hem to keep things cold a like a steel double walled vacuum sealed container, but as a plain insulated plastic bottle and it has worked for us. I've filled them half way and froze them or filled them with normal ice cubes and they work fine either way, the block will last slightly longer. We ride for 6-10 miles over an hour and there's always ice left after we get home. This is rougly total over a period of 2 hours in 85o and 85% humidity in the northern midwest.
customer_reviews.author: Alek

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t keep water cold as described
customer_reviews.text: I gave this only a three stars because it is not up to the standards described. The water is hot within a matter of 15-30 minutes. I love how easy it is to take it with me on a bike ride or a run and I fill it up with ice. By the time I am halfway through my bike ride the water is hot.
customer_reviews.author: Ghost Zero

customer_reviews.title: Better than Camelbak Big Chill
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my Camelbak Big Chill bottle with this one and am much happier with it because of the mouth piece. It's the standard pop top mouth piece that has been on water bottles for a long time and is easily opened with your teeth so you can drink one handed. That is the major promotion of the camelbak bottle, one handed use, but the mouth piece of the camelbak collects dirt that is nearly impossible to get out, which is why I opted to replace it with this bottle and very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Logan

customer_reviews.title: Great cycling water bottle!
customer_reviews.text: Great cycling water bottle! The new version of these include a removable look for easy grabbing or carrying, but I took mine off. I love the new designs and colors too. These water bottles (as you can see from all the reviews) are great and keeping water COLD. I normally freeze half the bottle with water and then fill the rest up with refrigerator water and it stays cold during my entire ride in the sun. Sometimes it won't even melt the ice block by the end of the ride so i carry two just in case. These bottles are not the lightest, but they do the best job at keeping water cold which is more important to me!
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Platt

customer_reviews.title: Great insulated, rugged water bottle
customer_reviews.text: My last Polar water bottle which I bought some 10 years ago was flawless until it got stolen at a music venue I was play at this past summer... I replaced it with this new one and it’s made of the same high quality as my old one... I I I I cannot recommend these bottles Highly enough..well done Polar😀😀😀
customer_reviews.author: Rod Welles

customer_reviews.title: Great quality water bottle - great for cycling
customer_reviews.text: My husband is a cyclist and says that this water bottle is wonderful. It fits perfectly into the holder on his bike, and eliminates the need for him to wear his hydration pack for shorter rides. We already own a few Polar bottles, but my husband needed one dedicated to the bike, and we didn't have any that were 24oz. The price was right, and we have no complaints. In fact, my husband mentioned buying another bottle holder to mount to his bike...so we may need another water bottle!
customer_reviews.author: Heather Rose

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Not able to clean this bottle properly. Mold and mildew collected and made it useless
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect water bottle for my needs
customer_reviews.text: These are great water bottles. I bought two, then had to buy two more, since my daughter wanted them! They hold 24 oz., which is quite a bit. I carry two on my bike here in the desert. Keeps the "cold" water cool enough in the heat. Add ice and it keeps it cold longer. I like the spout design - the old fashioned type - I can use my teeth to open the spout so that I can ride one-handed while drinking from this. Nice pull handle for retrieving it from the water bottle holder as well. A MUST HAVE item if you are going to ride in the heat! And the price was great too!
customer_reviews.author: Desert Dweller

customer_reviews.title: It holds water.  It doesn't keep it cool.
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something lighter than stainless steel, with thermal features, and this seemed to fit the bill. Except that it doesn't keep a drink cooler any longer than a regular plastic bottle. If you want what I wanted, keep looking. This is not it.
customer_reviews.author: vn dd

customer_reviews.title: Does everything it's supposed to do
customer_reviews.text: The sports bottle is perfect for whatever activity you are engaged in. I use it at the gym and I have another one like it on my bike. It keeps the liquid cold and it's a large container for your workout or cycling.
customer_reviews.author: Delta88

customer_reviews.title: Keeps water very cold and fits on my bike perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Polar insulated water bottle to replace one that I have had for over 15 years. After many years of use, the cap started to deteriorate so I thought it was time. This new bottle keeps my water very cold on long bike rides and it fits perfectly in the holder on my bike. The shape of the bottle makes it easy to grab while I am riding. I have not yet tried it in spinning class but I am fairly certain it will fit the bikes in my gym. I am pleased with this insulated bottle and would recommend it to cyclists.
customer_reviews.author: myoreo

customer_reviews.title: Not sanitary
customer_reviews.text: The mouth piece is too expose . While working out need a drink I have to use my hand to touch the tip to adjust to open and at Walgreens I got a flip top and I don’t have to touch the tip
customer_reviews.author: anne hall

customer_reviews.title: Great item, keeps water cool.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one for my son and one for my husband and they both love it! My son who is 22 has thanked me several times for making this purchase. I’m ordering a few more for my employees. The price is great for the quality of the item! I highly recommend this water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Lillian Mora

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with the Purchase
customer_reviews.text: I don't actually like my liquids very cold when exercising so I can't speak to the insulated aspect. These have been a good buy and I like the extra ounces for longer rides. They clean easily (the nozzle comes out for a more thorough wash) and seem durable. They fit well/snug in the bottle cages of my commuter, my carbon road bike and my cyclocross bike. If you are small and have a small framed bike, beware that the 24-ounce might be a tight fit in the seat tube bottle cage.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Maier

customer_reviews.title: My Go To Water Bottle
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using these for years and they really do a good job of keeping water cold with ice in them and they hold up to abuse. No reason to look elsewhere for an insulated water bottle especially for the price.
customer_reviews.author: T-Bone

customer_reviews.title: Lasts forever, good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bottle a long time ago, I still use it every day. It holds a good amount of water and it is easy to clean. I don't like cold water so I use room temp water so cannot say how long the water stays cold but I removed a start for that reason..
customer_reviews.author: M. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: making it easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I am a stickler for using water/food products made in the USA. I searched for a while for a USA made water bottle... and then I happened upon Polar Bottle. This water bottle has been through rigorous use with me, but continues to hold up well. Every piece comes apart, making it easy to clean. Every now and again water seeps out the cap around the threading, but I think it is my own fault for squeezing the bottle too tightly to screw the cap on. Great product and if the one I have currently ever wears out, I will be promptly buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep beverages cold
customer_reviews.text: Fine for carrying water or juice but not if you want it to stay cold. Ice melts in a very short time. It only appears to be an insulated bottle its actually just plain old plastic container.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: There's no flavor to this water bottle which is great, didn't want that. It was open my packaged when it arrive and stuffed into my mailbox. Regardless, it didn't damage the water bottle which I was happy to see.
customer_reviews.author: Denise

customer_reviews.title: Why are there words embedded at the top?
customer_reviews.text: The only thing I don't like about this water bottle is that there are words on the top embedded into it; allowing dirt and whatever grim is around to collect into it, and its a pain to clean. I've had water bottles that didn't have words embedded into its top, so I can't see why a water bottle needs to have any. Other than that its a cool water bottle I use it all the time and keep it near my bed in case I get a dry throat.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Douglas

customer_reviews.title: A good bottle!
customer_reviews.text: I'm dying for a dishwasher safe leak proof bottle for my kids. This is that, and my kids love all the color variations. I would recommend this water bottle! Also, it most likely won't break when dropped like other hard plastic bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Jenn

customer_reviews.title: Really does what it says.  Best on the go and workout bottle.
customer_reviews.text: Does exactly what it says. No sweat ever from this. I can put it in my bag without swearing or leaking all over my stuff, never have to wipe my hands off or worry about water stains on wood. The liner is within the walls which is brilliant. It is great for working out so you don't chug your water, since it's not a heavy pour out when you drink from it. But too slow when you're dehydrated on hot days. But overall I love it and would buy again and recommend to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Stays cold all day
customer_reviews.text: These bottles are great. Beverage stays cold all day. There is still ice inside at the end of the day and the bottle doesn't sweat and get everything wet. I also like that it's lightweight compared to the Hydroflasks. The Hydroflasks also stay cold all day but are very heavy and don't come with a drinking spout (you have to buy that separately). The Hydroflasks also cost a lot more. This bottle is a very good alternative, especially if you're carrying your bottle around everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Don't expect it to keep your beverage cold for long!
customer_reviews.text: I can fill this Polar Bottle up with ice cubes to the top and within 3 hours, the ice is completely melted. I like to have water at my beside for night time medications and within hours the beverage inside is no longer cold. Very disappointing purchase and I would not recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good but NASTY TOP
customer_reviews.text: Poor design to carve text into the nozzle that you drink from. Stuff gets stuck in the tiny letters and it's impossible to clean, gets nasty, and starts growing mold even. I ended up shaving the nozzle with a knife to get rid of the text. Otherwise it's a nice bottle snd holds cold well especially with ice cubes inside.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Cooler than your average
customer_reviews.text: Minnesota summers are humid, hot, and short lived. Getting out while you can is tough, and keeping hydrated is a must. I can't drink hot fluids unless it is coffee, and these bottles are a lifesaver. I freeze the bottom third the night before a ride, top off with ice cold water right before I leave, and I'm drinking cool water the whole ride. The 24oz bottles are tall, and may not fit in a seat post mounted cage. I recommend buying a 20oz if that's your intended placement. I would buy more of these tomorrow if I lost them today.
customer_reviews.author: Travis S

customer_reviews.title: Neato
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my son who uses it everyday. He really likes it, he puts ice in it in the early morning and he said it stays cold for awhile. It's pretty large, so not so easy to put it in the water bottle holder of his backpack but he loves it, so..so what?
customer_reviews.author: Magpie126

customer_reviews.title: Holds odors and not well insulated.
customer_reviews.text: OKAY: This holds liquid and does not leak. If you fill it with ice cubes and cold water the water will be somewhat cool two hours later. It is unremarkable and not expensive. I used it for orange juice and it will not come clean of that smell. I am put off by that and would not buy it again. Also, I would say that it may be insulated, but not very effectively.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Fitzpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good  , not perfect  ; but what is ?
customer_reviews.text: Love the shape , love the size , love the color. It keeps my water cold for maybe 45 minutes , without ice in it . So , in the Florida heat , by adding ice , it extends the time that my water stays cold , significantly !
customer_reviews.author: mario

customer_reviews.title: works as intended
customer_reviews.text: I have two of these. They've lasted 3000 miles, from Los Angeles to Miami in the Summer, plus probably another couple thousand since then. One downside: while the bottle itself has heat reflective insulation, the cap does not. They did keep my water cold in all but the hottest conditions (112°F in the Imperial Sand Dunes in California). For the price, these can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: srth

customer_reviews.title: Good Insulated biking bottle!
customer_reviews.text: Better than uninsulated water bottles. I've previously had to freeze biking water bottles, but by the end of the one hour bike trek, the ice is completely melted and warm. With this, I add ice and water, in the same heat and humidity, and water is still cold after 2 hours or more. Fits well in the bike holder, and holds a good amount of iced water.
customer_reviews.author: JG Yahtzee

customer_reviews.title: great product, works perfectly with my specialized water bottle ...
customer_reviews.text: great product, works perfectly with my specialized water bottle holder. it' does what it says it needs to do and keeps my drinks relatively cool on a hot riding day. comfort and easy of drinking isn't bad, my only complaint is the size of it doesn't hold very much water for long runs so i'd recommend having two bottles and holders.
customer_reviews.author: Nam N.

customer_reviews.title: Best of the best
customer_reviews.text: This is the third time I have purchased one of these bottles. They are excellent for long bike rides.
customer_reviews.author: Buckeye8101

customer_reviews.title: Looks cheap
customer_reviews.text: This just has a piece of paper inside to add the blue color. Looks cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a smaller bottle for cycling. Does everything I need it to do. Holds liquid. Doesn't leak, unless you lose your mind and forget to screw the top on. However... - Do not expect this to keep your beverage cold for long. It has been good for a few hours, but if you need it to stay cold longer you''re going to be disappointed. - While it doesn't "sweat" so badly it drips, it is going to feel wet in your hand. I give it three stars mainly because, although it works great for my use, remember it is a very inexpensive product. And with this one, you really do get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: The Ville Phil

customer_reviews.title: okay
customer_reviews.text: Not what I expected when I bought it. Also didn't fit in my bikes water bottle holder, so I ended up giving it away. I expected this to be plain blue, but it looks like there is 2 layers of plastic with insulator foil between them.
customer_reviews.author: Glacias

customer_reviews.title: Cool bottle
customer_reviews.text: I bought one Polar bottle and one Camelback Big Chill water bottle. Both are very good and great value for money. I would recommend both of these, but if I had to pick one I would probably go for the Camelback. Bit better quality but you pay a few dollars more. Well worth the extra money. The Polar bottle keeps your drink cool but it makes this crinkling noise when you squeeze it. The Camelback is easier to squeeze and delivers the water in a nice stream. If you want to save a couple of bucks, buy the Polar, you won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AussieBuyer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent water bottle
customer_reviews.text: This is a great water bottle. I have never been able to find an insulated cycling bottle, so my water when biking is always at the ambient temperature. This one keeps my water cold for quite a while It is also durable.
customer_reviews.author: JLRITH

customer_reviews.title: Great Insulated Water Bottle
customer_reviews.text: I'm super happy with my purchase of the Polar Insulated Water Bottle (24-ounce). Pros: - Keeps liquids cold for 2+ hours with it's dual-walled construction. - Lid and spout are easy to open/close yet secure. - Fits most bike bottle water holders. Worked on mine fine. Cons: - The pictures of the Polar water bottles look darker than the actual product. The colors in these water bottles are from vinyl inside the dual-wall. That means the colors are much lighter than in the product pictures.
customer_reviews.author: R. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This bottle is great and keeps the water cold. I had was I went with the 24oz bottle instead of the 20oz because the price was only 20 cents more. The problem with my choice is on my bike the 24oz has to be squeezed into place because it's slightly bigger and the position of the screws on my bike are in the middle rather than slightly back, so I should have went with the smaller one. I didn't think the extra inch would matter but it did. So if in doubt about which size to get, go with the smaller 20oz bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Gump

customer_reviews.title: Keeps the water cool for my entire workout at the gym.
customer_reviews.text: Great water bottle. Clean after each use as it can easily accumulate mold inside the bottle if you don't.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Nice grip. Not crazy about the sippy part but ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a water bottle. Works as a water bottle. Nice grip. Not crazy about the sippy part but it's what I expected. I prefer a flip lid. Doesn't leek. Easy to clean. Durable.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Schnitt

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't keep water colder than any other water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Didn't really keep water that cold. But we were at Disney world in July so I didn't expect it to stay cold all day anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Rene McConkey

customer_reviews.title: This is the best water bottle I have ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best water bottle I have ever owned! I just received the 24 oz one and am going to purchase 2 more for myself and two 12 oz ones for my kids. I am always, always drinking water and have a water bottle with me at all times. I am always trying to find the "perfect" water bottle. Well I don't have to look any further because I have found it! I love the shape and grip of the bottle.. So easy to hold. And I love that it insulates well and is easy to squeeze. Plus I love all the different design options. Highly recommend this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Andrea Burnett

customer_reviews.title: Great water bottle! Insulation could use some work.
customer_reviews.text: It's a fantastic bottle to use for outdoors - however, the insulation doesn't work as well as I would like. The water doesn't stay cold for too long as compared to other bottles that are insulated. But if you're going for a short bike ride, works great.
customer_reviews.author: Neil Shah

customer_reviews.title: Polar water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed a bottle to carry my water. Keeps it cold
customer_reviews.author: Janice Kalain

customer_reviews.title: Well insulated bottle.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bottle for my wife to carry tea in our car. It is insulated and it works well. Because of the insulation this bottle is a bit taller than I expected for being a 24 ounce bottle. But it is well made and she likes it. So it is great.
customer_reviews.author: DuaneD

customer_reviews.title: Very Kool
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. They work well, dishwasher safe, and keep things cool. I bought two of the 24 oz size. I would recommend that you should purchase a 20oz and a 24 oz size or just one 20 oz size. The 24 oz size is a little awkward when it comes to height. I still give this product a thumbs up. Very good for the price and does what it is supposed to..
customer_reviews.author: Retired Dude

customer_reviews.title: About 3 hours
customer_reviews.text: You fill it up with ice, then add your water, and you've got cold water for about 3 hours with these things. They fit well into normal cycling bottle holders and are lightweight. The plastic smell I've heard about in other reviews is really rather mild when they are new, I was expecting something pretty bad... but it wasn't really at all. I'd buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: T. Thomas

customer_reviews.title: to tall
customer_reviews.text: The 24 oz bottles are to tall for the way my bike bottle cages are located on my bike. Also looked at them on a couple, other bikes they were to tall for them too. Exchanged for the 20oz bottles which are shorter. The bottles don't fit the cages well and have to be positioned properly in the cages or they could rattle out if not carful. Averall they are good and I would buy these again
customer_reviews.author: MT

customer_reviews.title: Hard bottle
customer_reviews.text: Actually it looks bigger than it is, I also own camelbak one which are nice expect the smell. With this one there is no plastic smell yet but it is little hard to drink because you cannot squeeze the like a water bottle, they are quite rigid. Still looking for my perfect bottle, between this and camelbak one I prefer this one because of the plastic smell, otherwise camelback is a better design.
customer_reviews.author: Emre Isiklar

customer_reviews.title: great bottle
customer_reviews.text: i finally have a water bottle that fits my needs. have gotten more than one.
customer_reviews.author: aRandomGuyDudeFellow

customer_reviews.title: OK, but I would not buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: Generic. Used it a couple times and then tossed it out.
customer_reviews.author: ta

customer_reviews.title: Not what expected.
customer_reviews.text: I was excited to get this water bottle to be able to carry with the little handle. It was good at first, but it didn’t kee the liquids as cool as I thought. And then my kid started leaking as I drank it. Adjusted putting lid on and it’s still leaking. So no use to me after not even a month.
customer_reviews.author: Kris Kable

customer_reviews.title: oversized water bottle
customer_reviews.text: I guess it works good, but you put ice and water in it, it seems to empty out really quickly--like it really doesn't hold much water. I suppose for a long bike ride it may work well, but not for my purposes...Like the Nalgene BPA free Titan bottles much better. But, don't take my word for it, heck, the guy, Bob may like it, the one who also wrote a review...
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Fabulous bottle
customer_reviews.text: After trying one of these I bought several more. I freeze them with a little water in the bottom and they manage to keep it cold even on the warmest days. I also don't have the problem with condensation I get when throwing other bottles in my bag. They are the only water bottles I buy now. I also love the blue color. Great having color choices so we can tell whose bottle is whose.
customer_reviews.author: Here is my honest opinion

customer_reviews.title: Great for husand's bike rides
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for his bike rides. Stays cold and fits snugly in the bike holder.
customer_reviews.author: Karen K.

customer_reviews.title: Great with a couple of faults
customer_reviews.text: Really nice bottle with carry loop. It does not keep beverage cold for very long. I do like that it will fit water bottle holder on bicycle and easily squeezable. You do need to have a bottle brush to clean inside, especially if you use anything but water.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Insulates well, but the cap keeps leaking. I'm not sure what to do.
customer_reviews.author: LolaMango

customer_reviews.title: Mildew after 1 week
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 2 of these and after 1 week of use (with daily cleaning) 1 is completely covered in black mildew spots all over the inside. Washing it in the dishwasher did nothing. Disgusting
customer_reviews.author: 3hearts

customer_reviews.title: Good water bottle
customer_reviews.text: Keeps water cold and doesn't add a plasticy taste to the water. Of course you have to watch it prior to use. The only issue with this it the top portion he portion above the area where it tapers in is hard to squeeze. This only poses a problem when bike riding because you hold the bottle from this area,
customer_reviews.author: Thirdbase

customer_reviews.title: Ok if you don't mind a rubbery taste.
customer_reviews.text: Decent bottle, but poor drink spout and a strong plastic - rubber taste even after multiple washes.
customer_reviews.author: J White

customer_reviews.title: Nice and colorful
customer_reviews.text: It is a nice and colorful bottle and it is big enough, I fill it completely with water when I work out and I finish the almost all of the water inside it by the end of my workout, however, the top lid will hurt your downside lip if you try to open and close it using your mouth, so you better use your hand when you open and close the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: khalil9107

customer_reviews.title: This is an OK water bottle for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is an OK product. It keeps the water cold for about 2 1/2 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Bonner-Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Eh...  it's ok.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter bought this for school. It is kind of cheap.
customer_reviews.author: CASSIE LEE

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't keep the water as cold as I would like. Also it fits loose in the bike water bracket.
customer_reviews.author: William W. McCarty

customer_reviews.title: Insulated water bottle - water stays cold on bike in hot weather
customer_reviews.text: What a great idea! An insulated water bottle that hooks on a bike and keeps the water cold! Anyone who has taken an ice-filled water bottle on a long trek knows how quickly the ice melts and the water reaches air temperature. With this bottle everything stays cold much longer and less ice is needed in the first place, meaning more water can go with you. And non-toxic materials are a real plus.
customer_reviews.author: Golfing Eagle

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: The price was reasonable, but it's flimsy and too tall. I just don't care for it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle, keeps drinks cold
customer_reviews.text: I use this bottle all the time and it keeps my water cold. Sometimes if it's going to be hot out I'll fill it halfway with water at night, freeze it, then top it off in the morning before heading out for my bike ride to work; this'll keep things cold probably for 3-4+ hours. Have had it for about a year and it's worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Wes

customer_reviews.title: Melts in dishwasher
customer_reviews.text: Product description says dishwasher safe but washed one time on top shelf of dishwasher and the bottle warped and no longer seals. Is currently useless. Would like a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Thought ice would stay cold but it didn't it melted ...
customer_reviews.text: Thought ice would stay cold but it didn't it melted just as fast as it would in a plastic cup. I was just hoping for something that would at least keep chilled for a few hours but the ice was gone within 30 minutes. Kinda disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I got Two
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for. Why are other bottles sold?
customer_reviews.author: Gregory D Ouellette

customer_reviews.title: Great water bottle for my bicycles
customer_reviews.text: Great water bottle for my bicycles. I have yet to have it leak so I can putit in the back of the car on its side and not have to worry.
customer_reviews.author: NickD

customer_reviews.title: Sad
customer_reviews.text: Wanted this for the gym. I filled with ice and water and the ice was gone in less then 4 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Pam

customer_reviews.title: Really great water bottle for the price - keeps water cold ...
customer_reviews.text: Really great water bottle for the price - keeps water cold for eons! We are in Texas, so we fill the bottles about 1/4 with water and put them in the freezer. Then top them off and they have cold water for 3-4 hours in 100 degree heat. The pieces are simple to wash and keep clean. A+
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my son to keep hydrated during soccer. The top is very tight and hard for him to open. Unfortunately he bit the top to open it too many times and it now leaks. Other then that it does the trick
customer_reviews.author: Jenniffer Baker

customer_reviews.title: Definitely works better than a standard uninsulated bottle and has a little ...
customer_reviews.text: Definitely works better than a standard uninsulated bottle and has a little more capacity than some. Will fit in a standard holder.
customer_reviews.author: Jarrett

customer_reviews.title: Does not work as stated
customer_reviews.text: This water bottle does not keep water cold or cool. I'm not sure why it was rated so high, because the water is warm when I go to drink it. I would not recommend this item if you are looking for a supposedly "insulated" water bottle to keep your water even the slightest bit cool...because it doesn't. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: J. Price

customer_reviews.title: Good, not great..
customer_reviews.text: I think these are good water bottles, but for the price they aren't the best. They don't sweat on the outside which is great for my son's book bag, but even when I fill it with ice at noon, by 4:30 when he comes home, the ice is melted and the water isn't very cold. I thought it would stay colder longer than that.
customer_reviews.author: bgorlando

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: Keeps the water colder longer which is always a plus on the longer rides through the trace. I actually found that filling it half with ice will give me the perfect amount of time to get some fluids and then at the end of the ride the ice has melted but the the water is still ice cold...
customer_reviews.author: merlin696

customer_reviews.title: Not bad, not great
customer_reviews.text: Bottle does sweat and unlike other reviewers I cannot get frozen solid water to last longer than 5 hours.Even at work with air conditioning the ice melts before lunch time. Maybe my expectations were too high because of the reviews I had read.
customer_reviews.author: Coltsjab

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what it says it is
customer_reviews.text: This is just a squeeze bottle. No bells and whistles. It has a cool pack that will keep your water chilled for a few hours unless you are out in the heat (then you may get an hour). It is semi-soft plastic so don't bite the spout or you will be replacing it. I like the nylon loop.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy

customer_reviews.title: Love!
customer_reviews.text: Kept ice for a good 2 hrs not as long as I would have liked. I have started filling it halfway with water then freezing it. When its time to go to sports I fill it the rest of the way with water. It keeps cold much longer!
customer_reviews.author: Julie

customer_reviews.title: Work great
customer_reviews.text: These work great. Bought them because my friend water was alway cold when mine wasn’t.
customer_reviews.author: Cheermomred

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: We love these bottles. I would not recommend freezing with the lid on. One of two lids that we have, broke when we tried to use immediately after removing from freezer. They stay cold for a few hours at 80 degrees in our house. Love that they can be squeezed.
customer_reviews.author: A. King

customer_reviews.title: I'm spoiled...........
customer_reviews.text: It fits nicely in my water bottle holder on the bike but It is not as well insulated as I thought it would be - maybe I'm just spoiled having a Contigo metal insulated water bottle that I use daily. I would have paid more to have something that would keep things colder longer
customer_reviews.author: Joanne Paradis

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't seem quite as insulated as I thought it would ...
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't seem quite as insulated as I thought it would be, so works well to carry water. Not sure how well it would do with ice tea, as the ice seems to melt and water down the tea. In water, melting ice really isn't a problem, is it...
customer_reviews.author: S.

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend freezing half the water for best results. I went bike riding on a sunny day when the temperature was well above 90 degrees. An hour an a half later, not only was the water still cold, but there was still a nice piece of ice inside. I was pleasantly surprised to say the least. I will never go back to a regular water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: J. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Water stays cold for hours
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Water stays cold for hours. Strong design that can take quite a beating. I've been using one 3-4 times a week for the last two years, and it's wonderful. Bought a second to use on my bike.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Easy to carry and clean. Does not give any bad taste to water
customer_reviews.author: Rishi

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Works well for holding water with ice cold for maybe three hours. Easy to use and clean.
customer_reviews.author: Lamar W. Reynolds Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Can never go wrong with these water bottles. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Can never go wrong with these water bottles. I used to use these when I went to a dry sauna, and it kept my water cold for a relatively long time.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

customer_reviews.title: Colder drinks
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my old water bottle that had cracked. I am very impressed with this bottle as it keeps my drinks cold for a long time. Also looks really cool the way the design is. Great price I think I will enjoy this for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Eugene Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Cleanning Difficulty
customer_reviews.text: The construction of the mug makes it difficult to clean. Some of the design crevices support mold and are difficult to get out. I would return it but my window is past.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: topflight quality!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: these are the best made highest quality water bottles you can get,any thing you put in a water bottle on a bike with the sun beaming on it will get warm but this insulated bottle will keep it cold longer,nice!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: mrdebjr

customer_reviews.title: Good bottle
customer_reviews.text: Nice bottle. I now use this bottle everyday and love it. The insulation qualities are ok and if you shake it to mix your drink it leaks a bit but other then that high quality materials and well made. The fact that its still squishy is real nice to. Fits on my bike
customer_reviews.author: Cody

product_meta.title: Polar Bottle Insulated Water Bottle 24 oz - 100% BPA-Free Cycling and Sports Water Bottle - Dishwasher & Freezer Safe (Blue, 24 ounce)
product_meta.description: Color:Blue| Style:24 OzPolar bottle is the original insulated plastic Sport bottle and has been keeping liquids colder, longer, since 1994. The bottle has evolved in the years since with brightly colored foil liners and patterns and an innovative removable Valve system. Made in America, Polar bottle is popular throughout the world.
feature_bullets: THE ORIGINAL INSULATED WATER BOTTLE - As the first to make insulated, BPA-free plastic sports water bottles, Polar Bottle has had over 20 years to perfect keeping liquids stored and cool for twice as long.

ULTIMATE THERMAL PROTECTION - The double-wall construction of our insulated water bottles creates a thermal barrier of air to keep heat out and cold in. Foil layers reflect solar rays for additional thermal protection. Dishwasher and freezer safe.

SPORTS OR BIKE WATER BOTTLE - Our 20 oz. size, the first size we made and our top seller today, is the active way to hydrate. Take it everywhere you go, from a run to a drive to a bike ride. Wide mouth accommodates ice cubes and makes it easy to clean.

100% BPA-FREE WATER BOTTLE - Polar Bottle water bottles are and always have been 100% BPA-free and phthalate-free. Constructed of durable, lightweight and FDA food grade approved LDPE. Removable carrying strap offers extra convenience.

MADE IN THE USA- Polar Bottle Insulated Water Bottles are proudly made in the USA to reduce environmental impact and support local economies. Designed to last, each one of our water bottles comes with a lifetime guarantee.
